 <a href="

Goose Boxer is an old school gem featuring brilliantly detailed and creative choreography and a delightfully bawdy sense of humor.

As the filmÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s opening credits roll our hero, Chin Po (Charles Heung) gets a face full of goose excrement, thus signaling the start of an irreverently entertaining film that masks some deceptively rich kung fu action. Chin Po is a goose vendor who is sent to learn kung fu from his uncle, but he never gets there.
 Instead, he ends up in a scuffle and is mistaken for a kung fu expert by Shou Chan Yip, the bungling inheritor of a famed martial arts school that is in decline. Chan Yip gets Chin Po drunk and declares him the schoolÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s new teacher, a master of the Crane Fist technique. This charade last long enough for Chin Po to be kidnapped by a real Crane Fist expert known as the White Crested Crane (Lee Hoi Sang).
 For unknown reasons, he begins to sadistically force-train his reluctant student. This turns out to be a trap White Crested Crane sets to draw out his enemy, Lung Chung Fung (Phillip Ko Fei) who sends two of his students to the gym to learn Chin PoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Crane technique. Chin discovers that heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s just being used and joins forces with Chung Fung, but his new ally is killed leaving Chin Po without the necessary skills to defeat White Crested Crane.
 Chan Yip tells him to study a kung fu manual that turns out to be 108 sexual exercises instead!   To survive, heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s going to have to rely on a newly created style known as goose boxing and a little help from a dwarf.

**p.s watch out for that dwarf - very funny!!
